name: detour-factor
description:
The detour-factor command measures how direct the road network is by comparing actual network distances to straight-line distances. A detour factor of 1.0 means perfectly direct routes; higher values indicate more circuitous paths.

Useful for:
- Network connectivity analysis
- Urban planning assessment
- Comparing different areas
- Identifying areas with poor connectivity

options.-m, --mode: Travel mode: walk, bike, drive (default: drive)
options.--sample: Number of random point pairs to sample (default: 100)

output:
Detour factor statistics:
- Mean, median, min, max detour factors
- 10th and 90th percentiles
- Interpretation (excellent/good/average/poor)
- Sample route details

Typical values: 1.1-1.3 (excellent), 1.3-1.5 (good), 1.5-1.8 (average), >1.8 (poor)
